definition: to recruit/to provoke/to beckon/to incur/to infect/contagious/a move (chess)/a maneuver/device/trick/to confess
canvass for contributions/to recruit/to collect/to raise

sentences.english: TDF for a minimum of 12 months were recruited to this single centre study.
sentences.chinese: 至少12个月，华盈被招募到这个单中心研究。

sentences.english: Dahomey Amazons: this unit is available when holding territory in North Africa.
sentences.chinese: 必须拥有疆土在北非，这个单位是可招募的。

sentences.english: The US presence is just a recruiting poster for the Taliban.
sentences.chinese: 美国的存在也就不过是张塔利班招募新兵的海报罢了。

sentences.english: You will help recruit the best optometrists for our new stores;
sentences.chinese: 您将协助我们的新店招募优秀，专业的验光师。

sentences.english: Some luxury companies recruit for sales trainees at China's top universities.
sentences.chinese: 部分奢侈品公司在中国最好的大学中招募销售实习生。

sentences.english: But when the pack had puppies, the other adults recruited him to babysit .
sentences.chinese: 但是包让人招募他照看婴孩小狗，其它成年人。

sentences.english: Safe havens have also afforded the militants endless opportunities to find new recruits.
sentences.chinese: 安全庇护所也为武装分子提供无限的机会去招募新兵。

sentences.english: He enlisted help from 10 Web-savvy volunteers and began soliciting donations on his blog.
sentences.chinese: 他在网上招募志愿者，并在博客中呼吁捐款捐物。

sentences.english: So why not recruit volunteers to try out chemicals for us?
sentences.chinese: 那为什么不招募志愿者替我们试验呢？

sentences.english: The best way to recruit scientists would be to break the development log-jam.
sentences.chinese: 招募科学家的最好办法是打破开发僵局。

sentences.english: Every financial holding company (FHC) has invested considerable capitals in establishing systems and in recruiting financial consultants for wealth management.
sentences.chinese: 各家金控公司皆投入大量资金在软硬体及人才招募上。

sentences.english: Remember, recruiting is the lifeblood of any successful college athletic program.
sentences.chinese: 记住，招募是任何大学运动项目成功的命门。

sentences.english: He and his staff bring in couples and observe them as they perform various tasks.
sentences.chinese: 他和他的部下招募情侣们并观察他们进行的各种活动。

sentences.english: HCIA Program advertisements will be removed from the website after close of application.
sentences.chinese: 职位截止申请后，有关的网上招募广告将被移除。

sentences.english: The dearth of returning migrants set off a desperate scramble this week to recruit workers.
sentences.chinese: 返城民工的短缺使得这周的招募工人变得饥不择食。

sentences.english: He moved here three years ago, when Mr. Masfuk first put out a call for Chinese teachers.
sentences.chinese: 在麦夫克县长招募中文教师的三年前来到了这里。

definition: to recruit soldiers and buy horses (idiom); to raise a large army/fig. to expand business/to recruit new staff
to enlist/to draft/to conscript/to appoint to an official position
to invite applications for a job/to recruit
to incorporate into one's troops/to weave in
to assemble/to concentrate/to mass/to build up/to marshal
